channel.title: Automated logbook posting - Boslof's strawpoll
channel.description:
Figured I'd crosspost Boslof's strawpoll from the Discord over here so more of the community will see it and there will be somewhere to put discussion:
[quote="i42-Boslof in #news"] `@everyone` Since I have seen it requested several times. I figured I'd make a poll about adding a way to share your logbook with others. http://www.strawpoll.me/16524006 [/quote]
Thoughts?

item.title: Automated logbook posting - Boslof's strawpoll
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
I don’t know if that’s possible, but I do know that the other way around is, and I often question why we don’t take advantage of that more often.

That being said, I would personally really appreciate a human bot doing the inverse if we choose to not pursue other solutions.

(the only downside is people may end up blaming you if you miss something, so)

item.title: Automated logbook posting - Boslof's strawpoll
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
I am an absolute no, and have several reasons.

  1. it’s more complicated for evils, Normally you have to tweak your logs on the fly, normally evils can pull off last minute changes in a reasonable time gap. (IE it takes 3-20 seconds for people to copy and paste logs, it takes 10-30 seconds to modify and paste logs, so people won’t think twice on someone taking 15-20 seconds to paste a log), with a 1 button method. taking more than 5 seconds will be “sus”.

The second is a bit less because it’s inherant in the game and always will be in this sort of game but.

  1. It’s broadly announcing that pasting logs is something that should be done as often as humanly possible. Basically that’s sending a message that vote for class or whisper whomever or whatever form it takes should happen early and often.

Read full topic

item.title: Automated logbook posting - Boslof's strawpoll
item.dc:creator: snipufin
item.description:
I think the most I’d accept is adding buttons to copy and paste, but I know Xblade doesn’t want people without the mechanical knowledge to Ctrl+C Ctrl+V to play the game. Turning a social aspect in the game into a mechanically different UI feels counter-intuitive, especially when the game is all about hiding your information. I feel it would be comparable to making a separate mechanic for copypasting chat logs: it would be impossible to fake them.

Read full topic
